properties.title: Contact & Support
properties.description: Get in contact with the authors of EJBCA for contributing, security notices or commercial support.

section.name: Commercial Support
section.p:
Ready-made commercial EJBCA PKI support
Support programs and other qualified professional services are provided by PrimeKey Solutions AB.

section.name: 3rd Party Integration
section.p:
Looking to integrate a 3rd party application with EJBCA? EJBCA has the most flexible range of standard, and non standard, protocols for seamless integration.
Contact PrimeKey if you need more information or assistance.

section.name: Security Notifications
section.p: If you have a security notification regarding EJBCA, please send an email to security at primekey dot com.

section.name: Contributors
section.p: The best way to contact the project administrators is by e-mail.

ul.li: Send an email to the ejbca-develop mailing list (see below).
Send an email directly to a project administrator.
Send an email to PrimeKey at sales at primekey dot se.

section.name: Documentation
section.p: First of all, have a look at the EJBCA documentation in the main menu. Browse the documentation and use the search function.

section.name: Training
section.p:
Established EJBCA PKI Training
Training Courses for enterprise users are held internationally by PrimeKey and partners.

section.name: Mailing Lists
section.p: There are two public EJBCA mailing lists hosted on Sourceforge. To subscribe to either list, or browse archived messages, simply click optional link(s) below.
The ejbca-news list delivers information such as the most recent EJBCA releases and important EJBCA features. This is a low traffic list.
The ejbca-develop list is used for technical discussions. Almost anything regarding EJBCA PKI can be posted on this list.

section.name: Discussion Forums
section.p: There are several public discussion forums that are used for EJBCA PKI discussions and requests for help etc.

section.name: IRC
section.p: EJBCA community support questions can be asked on the IRC channel (#ejbca) on irc.freenode.net. A nice and free-of-charge, web-based IRC client is available here. PrimeKey is usually available on the IRC channel during European office hours, and occasionally at other times too.
